pageContext.claim: “We've ended the war on coal. We have clean coal, beautiful, clean coal, another source of energy.”
pageContext.analysis: This is misleading. The war on coal is a rhetorical spin to the fact that cheap and abundant natural gas led to the replacement of coal as the primary source of electricity generation. Coal releases noxious chemicals and CO2 when it is burned, and electricity generating plants can reduce pollution by capturing the some of the emissions from the smokestack. But the coal itself is not cleaner.
